intro: Narcissus tingitanus, commonly known as the Gibraltar daffodil, is a species of flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula and North Africa. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with a white corona, which are typically 3–5 cm in diameter. The plant grows from a bulb and produces strap-shaped leaves that are often bluish-green in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and protected species in many regions.
